message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the sale of this product with you. I think it's a fantastic opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to offer it to you for $10,500. This is a great starting point, and I'm confident we can work together to find a mutually beneficial agreement.
Hi Alice, thank you for your initial offer. I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Hi Bob, thank you for your counteroffer. I understand your perspective, but I'm still looking to get a better price for the product. Considering its value to me, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering the product to you for $10,000. This is a fair compromise, and I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire this valuable asset.

Hi Alice, I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm thinking more along the lines of $9,200. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

Hi Bob, I understand your concerns about budget, and I'm willing to make another concession. However, I'm not willing to go any lower than $9,750. This is the lowest price I'm comfortable with, considering the product's value to me. I believe it's a fair compromise, and I'm eager to hear your thoughts.

Hi Alice, I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm thinking more along the lines of $9,200 is still a bit high for me. I'd be willing to pay $9,000, but that's as low as I can go. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

Hi Bob, I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget, and I appreciate your honesty. However, I'm still not comfortable selling the product for $9,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to get closer to my desired price. I'm offering the product to you for $9,500. This is the lowest price I'm willing to consider, and I hope you can understand my position.

Hi Alice, I understand that you're trying to get closer to your desired price, but I'm still not willing to go above $9,000. I'm willing to make one last offer: I'll meet you at $9,250. That's the highest I'm willing to go. If you're not comfortable with that, I'm afraid I'll have to explore other options.

Hi Bob, I understand that you're trying to make one last offer, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, I'm still not comfortable selling the product for $9,250. I'm willing to make one last counteroffer: I'll meet you at $9,800. This is the highest price I'm willing to consider, and I hope you can understand my position. If not, I'll have to explore other options, including selling the product to John for $12,000.

Hi Alice, I understand that you're trying to get the best price for the product, but I'm not willing to pay $9,800. I'm making one final offer: $9,000. If you're not willing to accept this price, I'll have to explore other options, including buying the product from John for $8,000. I hope you can understand my position and meet me at this price.
